meanings.definition: Walking or moving while asleep or in a sleep-like state.
meanings.sent1: Last night, I somnambulated around the house, unaware of my actions.
meanings.sent2: The child somnambulantly wandered through the dark room, guided by an unseen force.
meanings.sent3: The somnambulant sleeper ended up in the kitchen, mistaking the fridge for a bed.
meanings.sent4: In his dream, he somnambulated through a forest of towering trees, searching for a hidden treasure.
meanings.sent5: The somnambulant figure moved gracefully, as if dancing in a trance.

meanings.definition: Characterized by or pertaining to sleepwalking.
meanings.sent1: The somnambulant girl roamed the halls at night, her eyes closed in deep slumber.
meanings.sent2: The somnambulant patient was carefully monitored to prevent any nighttime accidents.
meanings.sent3: The somnambulant cat startled its owner by climbing the stairs while fast asleep.
meanings.sent4: The somnambulant clouds drifted lazily across the moonlit sky, painting a serene picture.
meanings.sent5: His somnambulant state made him appear as if he was under a mysterious spell.

meanings.sent1: The somnambulant man moved silently through the house, his eyes shut tight.
meanings.sent2: She woke up feeling somnambulant, unsure if her nighttime adventure was real.
meanings.sent3: The somnambulant dog chased imaginary squirrels in its dream-filled state.
meanings.sent4: The somnambulant moon cast a ghostly glow over the sleeping town.
meanings.sent5: The somnambulant atmosphere of the room gave it an eerie, otherworldly feel.
